member.name: T:Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.Administration.CreateQueueOptions
member.summary: Represents the set of options that can be specified for the creation of a queue.

member.name: M:Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.Administration.CreateQueueOptions.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of with the specified relative name.
member.param: Name of the queue relative to the namespace base address.

member.name: M:Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.Administration.CreateQueueOptions.#ctor(Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.Administration.QueueProperties)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of based on the specified instance. This is useful for creating a new queue based on the properties of an existing queue.
member.param: Existing queue to create options from.

member.name: P:Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.Administration.CreateQueueOptions.Name
member.summary: Name of the queue relative to the namespace base address.
member.remarks: Max length is 260 chars. Cannot start or end with a slash. Cannot have restricted characters: '@','?','#','*'

member.name: P:Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.Administration.CreateQueueOptions.LockDuration
member.summary: Duration of a peek lock receive. i.e., the amount of time that the message is locked by a given receiver so that no other receiver receives the same message.
member.remarks: Max value is 5 minutes. Default value is 60 seconds.

member.name: P:Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.Administration.CreateQueueOptions.MaxSizeInMegabytes
member.summary: The maximum size of the queue in megabytes, which is the size of memory allocated for the queue.
member.remarks: Default value is 1024.

member.name: P:Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.Administration.CreateQueueOptions.RequiresDuplicateDetection
member.summary: This value indicates if the queue requires guard against duplicate messages. If true, duplicate messages having same and sent to queue within duration of will be discarded.
member.remarks: Defaults to false.

member.name: P:Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.Administration.CreateQueueOptions.RequiresSession
member.summary: This indicates whether the queue supports the concept of session. Sessionful-messages follow FIFO ordering.
member.remarks: If true, the receiver can only receive messages using . Defaults to false.

member.name: P:Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.Administration.CreateQueueOptions.DefaultMessageTimeToLive
member.summary: The default time to live value for the messages. This is the duration after which the message expires, starting from when the message is sent to Service Bus.
member.remarks: This is the default value used when is not set on a message itself. Messages older than their TimeToLive value will expire and no longer be retained in the message store. Subscribers will be unable to receive expired messages. Default value is .

member.name: P:Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.Administration.CreateQueueOptions.AutoDeleteOnIdle
member.summary: The idle interval after which the queue is automatically deleted.
member.remarks: The minimum duration is 5 minutes. Default value is .

member.name: P:Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.Administration.CreateQueueOptions.DeadLetteringOnMessageExpiration
member.summary: Indicates whether this queue has dead letter support when a message expires.
member.remarks: If true, the expired messages are moved to dead-letter subqueue. Default value is false.

member.name: P:Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.Administration.CreateQueueOptions.DuplicateDetectionHistoryTimeWindow
member.summary: The duration of duplicate detection history that is maintained by the service.
member.remarks: The default value is 1 minute. Max value is 7 days and minimum is 20 seconds.

member.name: P:Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.Administration.CreateQueueOptions.MaxDeliveryCount
member.summary: The maximum delivery count of a message before it is dead-lettered.
member.remarks: The delivery count is increased when a message is received in mode and didn't complete the message before the message lock expired. Default value is 10. Minimum value is 1.

member.name: P:Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.Administration.CreateQueueOptions.EnableBatchedOperations
member.summary: Indicates whether server-side batched operations are enabled.
member.remarks: Defaults to true.

member.name: P:Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.Administration.CreateQueueOptions.AuthorizationRules
member.summary: The on the queue to control user access at entity level.

member.name: P:Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.Administration.CreateQueueOptions.Status
member.summary: The current status of the queue (Enabled / Disabled).
member.remarks: When an entity is disabled, that entity cannot send or receive messages.

member.name: P:Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.Administration.CreateQueueOptions.ForwardTo
member.summary: The name of the recipient entity to which all the messages sent to the queue are forwarded to.
member.remarks: If set, user cannot manually receive messages from this queue. The destination entity must be an already existing entity.

member.name: P:Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.Administration.CreateQueueOptions.ForwardDeadLetteredMessagesTo
member.summary: The name of the recipient entity to which all the dead-lettered messages of this queue are forwarded to.
member.remarks: If set, user cannot manually receive dead-lettered messages from this queue. The destination entity must already exist.

member.name: P:Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.Administration.CreateQueueOptions.EnablePartitioning
member.summary: Indicates whether the queue is to be partitioned across multiple message brokers.
member.remarks: Defaults to false.

member.name: P:Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.Administration.CreateQueueOptions.UserMetadata
member.summary: Custom metadata that user can associate with the queue.
member.remarks: Cannot be null. Max length is 1024 chars.

member.name: M:Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.Administration.CreateQueueOptions.GetHashCode
member.summary: Returns a hash code for this instance.

member.summary: Determines whether the specified object is equal to the current object.

member.summary: Determines whether the specified object is equal to the current object.

member.name: P:Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.Administration.QueueProperties.LockDuration
member.summary: Duration of a peek lock receive. i.e., the amount of time that the message is locked by a given receiver so that no other receiver receives the same message.
member.remarks: Max value is 5 minutes. Default value is 60 seconds.

member.name: P:Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.Administration.QueueProperties.MaxSizeInMegabytes
member.summary: The maximum size of the queue in megabytes, which is the size of memory allocated for the queue.
member.remarks: Default value is 1024.

member.name: P:Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.Administration.QueueProperties.RequiresDuplicateDetection
member.summary: This value indicates if the queue requires guard against duplicate messages. If true, duplicate messages having the same and sent to the queue within duration of will be discarded.
member.remarks: Defaults to false.

member.name: P:Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.Administration.QueueProperties.RequiresSession
member.summary: This indicates whether the queue supports the concept of session. Sessionful-messages follow FIFO ordering.
member.remarks: If true, the receiver can only receive messages using . Defaults to false.

member.name: P:Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.Administration.QueueProperties.DefaultMessageTimeToLive
member.summary: The default time to live value for the messages. This is the duration after which the message expires, starting from when the message is sent to Service Bus.
member.remarks: This is the default value used when is not set on a message itself. Messages older than their TimeToLive value will expire and no longer be retained in the message store. Subscribers will be unable to receive expired messages. Default value is .

member.name: P:Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.Administration.QueueProperties.AutoDeleteOnIdle
member.summary: The idle interval after which the queue is automatically deleted.
member.remarks: The minimum duration is 5 minutes. Default value is .

member.name: P:Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.Administration.QueueProperties.DeadLetteringOnMessageExpiration
member.summary: Indicates whether this queue has dead letter support when a message expires.
member.remarks: If true, the expired messages are moved to dead-letter subqueue. Default value is false.

member.name: P:Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.Administration.QueueProperties.DuplicateDetectionHistoryTimeWindow
member.summary: The duration of duplicate detection history that is maintained by the service.
member.remarks: The default value is 1 minute. Max value is 7 days and minimum is 20 seconds.

member.name: P:Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.Administration.QueueProperties.MaxDeliveryCount
member.summary: The maximum delivery count of a message before it is dead-lettered.
member.remarks: The delivery count is increased when a message is received in mode and didn't complete the message before the message lock expired. Default value is 10. Minimum value is 1.

member.name: P:Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.Administration.QueueProperties.EnableBatchedOperations
member.summary: Indicates whether server-side batched operations are enabled.
member.remarks: Defaults to true.

member.name: P:Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.Administration.QueueProperties.AuthorizationRules
member.summary: The on the queue to control user access at entity level.

member.name: P:Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.Administration.QueueProperties.Status
member.summary: The current status of the queue (Enabled / Disabled).
member.remarks: When an entity is disabled, that entity cannot send or receive messages.

member.name: P:Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.Administration.QueueProperties.ForwardTo
member.summary: The name of the recipient entity to which all the messages sent to the queue are forwarded to.
member.remarks: If set, user cannot manually receive messages from this queue. The destination entity must be an already existing entity.

member.name: P:Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.Administration.QueueProperties.ForwardDeadLetteredMessagesTo
member.summary: The name of the recipient entity to which all the dead-lettered messages of this queue are forwarded to.
member.remarks: If set, user cannot manually receive dead-lettered messages from this queue. The destination entity must already exist.

member.name: P:Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.Administration.QueueProperties.EnablePartitioning
member.summary: Indicates whether the queue is to be partitioned across multiple message brokers.
member.remarks: Defaults to false.

member.name: T:Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.Administration.CorrelationRuleFilter
member.summary: Represents the correlation rule filter expression.

remarks.para: A CorrelationRuleFilter holds a set of conditions that are matched against one of more of an arriving message's user and system properties. A common use is a match against the property, but the application can also choose to match against , , , , , , , and any user-defined properties. A match exists when an arriving message's value for a property is equal to the value specified in the correlation filter. For string expressions, the comparison is case-sensitive. When specifying multiple match properties, the filter combines them as a logical AND condition, meaning all conditions must match for the filter to match.

The CorrelationRuleFilter provides an efficient shortcut for declarations of filters that deal only with correlation equality. In this case the cost of the lexicographical analysis of the expression can be avoided. Not only will correlation filters be optimized at declaration time, but they will also be optimized at runtime. Correlation filter matching can be reduced to a hashtable lookup, which aggregates the complexity of the set of defined correlation filters to O(1).

member.name: T:Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.Administration.SqlRuleFilter
member.summary: Represents a filter which is a composition of an expression and an action that is executed in the pub/sub pipeline.
member.remarks: A holds a SQL-like condition expression that is evaluated in the broker against the arriving messages' user-defined properties and system properties. All system properties (which are all properties explicitly listed on the class) must be prefixed with sys. in the condition expression. The SQL subset implements testing for existence of properties (EXISTS), testing for null-values (IS NULL), logical NOT/AND/OR, relational operators, numeric arithmetic, and simple text pattern matching with LIKE.

member.name: T:Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.Administration.SubscriptionProperties
member.summary: Represents the static properties of the subscription.

member.name: M:Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.Administration.SubscriptionProperties.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of SubscriptionDescription class with the specified name and topic name.
member.param: Name of the topic relative to the namespace base address.
Name of the subscription.

member.name: P:Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.Administration.SubscriptionProperties.LockDuration
member.summary: Duration of a peek lock receive. i.e., the amount of time that the message is locked by a given receiver so that no other receiver receives the same message.
member.remarks: Max value is 5 minutes. Default value is 60 seconds.

member.name: P:Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.Administration.SubscriptionProperties.RequiresSession
member.summary: This indicates whether the subscription supports the concept of session. Sessionful-messages follow FIFO ordering.
member.remarks: If true, the receiver can only receive messages using . Defaults to false.

member.name: P:Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.Administration.SubscriptionProperties.DefaultMessageTimeToLive
member.summary: The default time to live value for the messages. This is the duration after which the message expires, starting from when the message is sent to Service Bus.
member.remarks: This is the default value used when is not set on a message itself. Messages older than their TimeToLive value will expire and no longer be retained in the message store. Subscribers will be unable to receive expired messages. Default value is .

member.name: P:Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.Administration.SubscriptionProperties.AutoDeleteOnIdle
member.summary: The idle interval after which the subscription is automatically deleted.
member.remarks: The minimum duration is 5 minutes. Default value is .

member.name: P:Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.Administration.SubscriptionProperties.DeadLetteringOnMessageExpiration
member.summary: Indicates whether this subscription has dead letter support when a message expires.
member.remarks: If true, the expired messages are moved to dead-letter subqueue. Default value is false.

member.name: P:Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.Administration.SubscriptionProperties.EnableDeadLetteringOnFilterEvaluationExceptions
member.summary: indicates whether messages need to be forwarded to dead-letter sub queue when subscription rule evaluation fails.
member.remarks: Defaults to true.

member.name: P:Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.Administration.SubscriptionProperties.TopicName
member.summary: Name of the topic under which subscription exists.
member.remarks: Value cannot be null or empty. Value cannot exceed 260 chars. Cannot start or end with a slash. Cannot have restricted characters: '@','?','#','*'

member.name: P:Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.Administration.SubscriptionProperties.SubscriptionName
member.summary: Name of the subscription.
member.remarks: Value cannot be null or empty. Value cannot exceed 50 chars. Cannot have restricted characters: '@','?','#','*','/','\'

member.name: P:Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.Administration.SubscriptionProperties.MaxDeliveryCount
member.summary: The maximum delivery count of a message before it is dead-lettered.
member.remarks: The delivery count is increased when a message is received in mode and didn't complete the message before the message lock expired. Default value is 10. Minimum value is 1.

member.name: P:Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.Administration.SubscriptionProperties.Status
member.summary: The current status of the subscription (Enabled / Disabled).
member.remarks: When an entity is disabled, that entity cannot send or receive messages.

member.name: P:Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.Administration.SubscriptionProperties.ForwardTo
member.summary: The name of the recipient entity to which all the messages sent to the subscription are forwarded to.
member.remarks: If set, user cannot manually receive messages from this subscription. The destination entity must be an already existing entity.

member.name: P:Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.Administration.SubscriptionProperties.ForwardDeadLetteredMessagesTo
member.summary: The name of the recipient entity to which all the dead-lettered messages of this subscription are forwarded to.
member.remarks: If set, user cannot manually receive dead-lettered messages from this subscription. The destination entity must already exist.

member.name: P:Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.Administration.SubscriptionProperties.EnableBatchedOperations
member.summary: Indicates whether server-side batched operations are enabled.
member.remarks: Defaults to true.

member.name: P:Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.Administration.SubscriptionProperties.UserMetadata
member.summary: Custom metadata that user can associate with the description.
member.remarks: Cannot be null. Max length is 1024 chars.

member.summary: List of properties that were retrieved using GetSubscription but are not understood by this version of client is stored here. The list will be sent back when an already retrieved SubscriptionDescription will be used in UpdateSubscription call.

member.name: M:Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.Amqp.AmqpReceiver.PeekMessagesAsync(System.Nullable{System.Int64},System.Int32,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Fetches a list of active messages without changing the state of the receiver or the message source.
member.param: The sequence number from where to read the message.
The maximum number of messages that will be fetched.
An optional instance to signal the request to cancel the operation.
member.remarks: The first call to (long, int, CancellationToken) fetches the first active message for this receiver. Each subsequent call fetches the subsequent message in the entity. Unlike a received message, peeked message will not have lock token associated with it, and hence it cannot be Completed/Abandoned/Deferred/Deadlettered/Renewed. Also, unlike , this method will fetch even Deferred messages (but not Deadlettered message)

member.summary:
Creates a size-constraint batch to which may be added using a try-based pattern. If a message would exceed the maximum allowable size of the batch, the batch will not allow adding the message and signal that scenario using its return value.
Because messages that would violate the size constraint cannot be added, publishing a batch will not trigger an exception when attempting to send the message to the Queue/Topic.

If the size of the messages exceed the maximum size of a single batch, an exception will be triggered and the send will fail. In order to ensure that the messages being sent will fit in a batch, use instead.
member.param: The list of messages to send.
An optional instance to signal the request to cancel the operation.

member.name: M:Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.Amqp.AmqpSender.CreateLinkAndEnsureSenderStateAsync(System.TimeSpan,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Creates the AMQP link to be used for sender-related operations and ensures that the corresponding state for the sender has been updated based on the link configuration.
member.param: The timeout to apply when creating the link.
The cancellation token to consider when creating the link.
member.returns: The AMQP link to use for sender-related operations.
member.remarks: This method will modify class-level state, setting those attributes that depend on the AMQP link configuration. There exists a benign race condition in doing so, as there may be multiple concurrent callers. In this case, the attributes may be set multiple times but the resulting value will be the same.

member.name: M:Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.Core.TransportReceiver.DeferAsync(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.Object},System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Indicates that the receiver wants to defer the processing for the message.
member.param: The lockToken of the to defer.
The properties of the message to modify while deferring the message.
An optional instance to signal the request to cancel the operation.
member.remarks: A lock token can be found in , only when is set to . In order to receive this message again in the future, you will need to save the and receive it using ReceiveDeferredMessageBatchAsync(IEnumerable, CancellationToken). Deferring messages does not impact message's expiration, meaning that deferred messages can still expire. This operation can only be performed on messages that were received by this receiver.
member.returns: A task to be resolved on when the operation has completed.

member.name: M:Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.Core.TransportReceiver.PeekMessagesAsync(System.Nullable{System.Int64},System.Int32,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Fetches the next batch of active messages without changing the state of the receiver or the message source.
member.param: The sequence number from where to read the message.
The maximum number of messages that will be fetched.
An optional instance to signal the request to cancel the operation.
member.remarks: The first call to PeekBatchBySequenceAsync(long, int, CancellationToken) fetches the first active message for this receiver. Each subsequent call fetches the subsequent message in the entity. Unlike a received message, peeked message will not have lock token associated with it, and hence it cannot be Completed/Abandoned/Deferred/Deadlettered/Renewed. Also, unlike , this method will fetch even Deferred messages (but not Deadlettered messages).

member.summary: Creates a new message from the specified received message by copying the properties.
member.param: The received message to copy the data from.

member.name: P:Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.ServiceBusMessage.Body
member.summary: Gets or sets the body of the message.

member.name: P:Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.ServiceBusMessage.MessageId
member.summary: Gets or sets the MessageId to identify the message.
member.remarks: The message identifier is an application-defined value that uniquely identifies the message and its payload. The identifier is a free-form string and can reflect a GUID or an identifier derived from the application context. If enabled, the duplicate detection feature identifies and removes second and further submissions of messages with the same MessageId.

member.name: P:Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.ServiceBusMessage.PartitionKey
member.summary: Gets or sets a partition key for sending a message to a partitioned entity.
member.value: The partition key. Maximum length is 128 characters.
member.remarks: For partitioned entities, setting this value enables assigning related messages to the same internal partition, so that submission sequence order is correctly recorded. The partition is chosen by a hash function over this value and cannot be chosen directly. For session-aware entities, the property overrides this value.

member.name: P:Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.ServiceBusMessage.TransactionPartitionKey
member.summary: Gets or sets a partition key for sending a message into an entity via a partitioned transfer queue.
member.value: The partition key. Maximum length is 128 characters.
member.remarks: If a message is sent via a transfer queue in the scope of a transaction, this value selects the transfer queue partition: This is functionally equivalent to and ensures that messages are kept together and in order as they are transferred. See Transfers and Send Via.

member.name: P:Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.ServiceBusMessage.SessionId
member.summary: Gets or sets the session identifier for a session-aware entity.
member.value: The session identifier. Maximum length is 128 characters.
member.remarks: For session-aware entities, this application-defined value specifies the session affiliation of the message. Messages with the same session identifier are subject to summary locking and enable exact in-order processing and demultiplexing. For session-unaware entities, this value is ignored. See Message Sessions.

member.name: P:Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.ServiceBusMessage.ReplyToSessionId
member.summary: Gets or sets a session identifier augmenting the address.
member.value: Session identifier. Maximum length is 128 characters.
member.remarks: This value augments the ReplyTo information and specifies which SessionId should be set for the reply when sent to the reply entity. See Message Routing and Correlation

member.name: P:Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.ServiceBusMessage.TimeToLive
member.summary: Gets or sets the message’s "time to live" value.
member.value: The message’s time to live value.
member.remarks: This value is the relative duration after which the message expires. When not set explicitly, the assumed value is the DefaultTimeToLive for the respective queue or topic. A message-level value cannot be longer than the entity's DefaultTimeToLive setting and it is silently adjusted if it does. See Expiration.

member.name: P:Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.ServiceBusMessage.CorrelationId
member.summary: Gets or sets the a correlation identifier.
member.value: Correlation identifier.
member.remarks: Allows an application to specify a context for the message for the purposes of correlation, for example reflecting the MessageId of a message that is being replied to. See Message Routing and Correlation.

member.name: P:Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.ServiceBusMessage.Subject
member.summary: Gets or sets an application specific subject.
member.value: The application specific subject.
member.remarks: This property enables the application to indicate the purpose of the message to the receiver in a standardized fashion, similar to an email subject line. The mapped AMQP property is "subject".

member.name: P:Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.ServiceBusMessage.To
member.summary: Gets or sets the "to" address.
member.value: The "to" address.
member.remarks: This property is reserved for future use in routing scenarios and presently ignored by the broker itself. Applications can use this value in rule-driven auto-forward chaining scenarios to indicate the intended logical destination of the message.

member.name: P:Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.ServiceBusMessage.ContentType
member.summary: Gets or sets the content type descriptor.
member.value: RFC2045 Content-Type descriptor.
member.remarks: Optionally describes the payload of the message, with a descriptor following the format of RFC2045, Section 5, for example "application/json".

member.name: P:Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.ServiceBusMessage.ReplyTo
member.summary: Gets or sets the address of an entity to send replies to.
member.value: The reply entity address.
member.remarks: This optional and application-defined value is a standard way to express a reply path to the receiver of the message. When a sender expects a reply, it sets the value to the absolute or relative path of the queue or topic it expects the reply to be sent to. See Message Routing and Correlation.

member.name: P:Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.ServiceBusMessage.ScheduledEnqueueTime
member.summary: Gets or sets the date and time in UTC at which the message will be enqueued. This property returns the time in UTC; when setting the property, the supplied DateTime value must also be in UTC.
member.value: The scheduled enqueue time in UTC. This value is for delayed message sending. It is utilized to delay messages sending to a specific time in the future.
member.remarks: Message enqueuing time does not mean that the message will be sent at the same time. It will get enqueued, but the actual sending time depends on the queue's workload and its state.

member.name: P:Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.ServiceBusMessage.AmqpMessage

member.name: P:Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.ServiceBusReceivedMessage.Body
member.summary: Gets the body of the message.

member.name: P:Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.ServiceBusReceivedMessage.MessageId
member.summary: Gets the MessageId to identify the message.
member.remarks: The message identifier is an application-defined value that uniquely identifies the message and its payload. The identifier is a free-form string and can reflect a GUID or an identifier derived from the application context. If enabled, the duplicate detection feature identifies and removes second and further submissions of messages with the same MessageId.

member.name: P:Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.ServiceBusReceivedMessage.PartitionKey
member.summary: Gets a partition key for sending a message to a partitioned entity.
member.value: The partition key. Maximum length is 128 characters.
member.remarks: For partitioned entities, setting this value enables assigning related messages to the same internal partition, so that submission sequence order is correctly recorded. The partition is chosen by a hash function over this value and cannot be chosen directly. For session-aware entities, the property overrides this value.

member.name: P:Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.ServiceBusReceivedMessage.TransactionPartitionKey
member.summary: Gets a partition key for sending a message into an entity via a partitioned transfer queue.
member.value: The partition key. Maximum length is 128 characters.
member.remarks: If a message is sent via a transfer queue in the scope of a transaction, this value selects the transfer queue partition: This is functionally equivalent to and ensures that messages are kept together and in order as they are transferred. See Transfers and Send Via.

member.name: P:Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.ServiceBusReceivedMessage.SessionId
member.summary: Gets the session identifier for a session-aware entity.
member.value: The session identifier. Maximum length is 128 characters.
member.remarks: For session-aware entities, this application-defined value specifies the session affiliation of the message. Messages with the same session identifier are subject to summary locking and enable exact in-order processing and demultiplexing. For session-unaware entities, this value is ignored. See Message Sessions.

member.name: P:Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.ServiceBusReceivedMessage.ReplyToSessionId
member.summary: Gets a session identifier augmenting the address.
member.value: Session identifier. Maximum length is 128 characters.
member.remarks: This value augments the ReplyTo information and specifies which SessionId should be set for the reply when sent to the reply entity. See Message Routing and Correlation

member.name: P:Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.ServiceBusReceivedMessage.TimeToLive
member.summary: Gets the message’s "time to live" value.
member.value: The message’s time to live value.
member.remarks: This value is the relative duration after which the message expires, starting from the instant the message has been accepted and stored by the broker, as captured in . When not set explicitly, the assumed value is the DefaultTimeToLive for the respective queue or topic. A message-level value cannot be longer than the entity's DefaultTimeToLive setting and it is silently adjusted if it does. See Expiration

member.name: P:Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.ServiceBusReceivedMessage.CorrelationId
member.summary: Gets the correlation identifier.
member.value: Correlation identifier.
member.remarks: Allows an application to specify a context for the message for the purposes of correlation, for example reflecting the MessageId of a message that is being replied to. See Message Routing and Correlation.

member.name: P:Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.ServiceBusReceivedMessage.Subject
member.summary: Gets an application specific label.
member.value: The application specific label
member.remarks: This property enables the application to indicate the purpose of the message to the receiver in a standardized fashion, similar to an email subject line. The mapped AMQP property is "subject".

member.name: P:Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.ServiceBusReceivedMessage.To
member.summary: Gets the "to" address.
member.value: The "to" address.
member.remarks: This property is reserved for future use in routing scenarios and presently ignored by the broker itself. Applications can use this value in rule-driven auto-forward chaining scenarios to indicate the intended logical destination of the message.

member.name: P:Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.ServiceBusReceivedMessage.ContentType
member.summary: Gets the content type descriptor.
member.value: RFC2045 Content-Type descriptor.
member.remarks: Optionally describes the payload of the message, with a descriptor following the format of RFC2045, Section 5, for example "application/json".

member.name: P:Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.ServiceBusReceivedMessage.ReplyTo
member.summary: Gets the address of an entity to send replies to.
member.value: The reply entity address.
member.remarks: This optional and application-defined value is a standard way to express a reply path to the receiver of the message. When a sender expects a reply, it sets the value to the absolute or relative path of the queue or topic it expects the reply to be sent to. See Message Routing and Correlation.

member.name: P:Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.ServiceBusReceivedMessage.ScheduledEnqueueTime
member.summary: Gets the date and time in UTC at which the message will be enqueued. This property returns the time in UTC; when setting the property, the supplied DateTime value must also be in UTC.
member.value: The scheduled enqueue time in UTC. This value is for delayed message sending. It is utilized to delay messages sending to a specific time in the future.
member.remarks: Message enqueuing time does not mean that the message will be sent at the same time. It will get enqueued, but the actual sending time depends on the queue's workload and its state.

member.name: P:Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.ServiceBusReceivedMessage.ApplicationProperties
member.summary: Gets the application properties bag, which can be used for custom message metadata.
member.remarks: Only following value types are supported: byte, sbyte, char, short, ushort, int, uint, long, ulong, float, double, decimal, bool, Guid, string, Uri, DateTime, DateTimeOffset, TimeSpan

member.name: P:Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.ServiceBusReceivedMessage.LockToken
member.summary: Gets the lock token for the current message.
member.remarks: The lock token is a reference to the lock that is being held by the broker in ReceiveMode.PeekLock mode. Locks are used to explicitly settle messages as explained in the product documentation in more detail. The token can also be used to pin the lock permanently through the Deferral API and, with that, take the message out of the regular delivery state flow. This property is read-only.

member.name: P:Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.ServiceBusReceivedMessage.DeliveryCount
member.summary: Get the current delivery count.
member.value: This value starts at 1.
member.remarks: Number of deliveries that have been attempted for this message. The count is incremented when a message lock expires, or the message is explicitly abandoned by the receiver. This property is read-only.

member.name: P:Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.ServiceBusReceivedMessage.LockedUntil
member.summary: Gets the date and time in UTC until which the message will be locked in the queue/subscription.
member.value: The date and time until which the message will be locked in the queue/subscription.
member.remarks: For messages retrieved under a lock (peek-lock receive mode, not pre-settled) this property reflects the UTC instant until which the message is held locked in the queue/subscription. When the lock expires, the is incremented and the message is again available for retrieval. This property is read-only.

member.name: P:Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.ServiceBusReceivedMessage.SequenceNumber
member.summary: Gets the unique number assigned to a message by Service Bus.
member.remarks: The sequence number is a unique 64-bit integer assigned to a message as it is accepted and stored by the broker and functions as its true identifier. For partitioned entities, the topmost 16 bits reflect the partition identifier. Sequence numbers monotonically increase. They roll over to 0 when the 48-64 bit range is exhausted. This property is read-only.

member.name: P:Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.ServiceBusReceivedMessage.DeadLetterSource
member.summary: Gets the name of the queue or subscription that this message was enqueued on, before it was dead-lettered.
member.remarks: Only set in messages that have been dead-lettered and subsequently auto-forwarded from the dead-letter queue to another entity. Indicates the entity in which the message was dead-lettered. This property is read-only.

member.name: P:Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.ServiceBusReceivedMessage.EnqueuedSequenceNumber
member.summary: Gets or sets the original sequence number of the message.
member.value: The enqueued sequence number of the message.
member.remarks: For messages that have been auto-forwarded, this property reflects the sequence number that had first been assigned to the message at its original point of submission. This property is read-only.

member.name: P:Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.ServiceBusReceivedMessage.EnqueuedTime
member.summary: Gets or sets the date and time of the sent time in UTC.
member.value: The enqueue time in UTC.
member.remarks: The UTC instant at which the message has been accepted and stored in the entity. This value can be used as an authoritative and neutral arrival time indicator when the receiver does not want to trust the sender's clock. This property is read-only.

member.name: P:Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.ServiceBusReceivedMessage.ExpiresAt
member.summary: Gets the date and time in UTC at which the message is set to expire.
member.value: The message expiration time in UTC. This property is read-only.
member.exception: If the message has not been received. For example if a new message was created but not yet sent and received.
member.remarks: The UTC instant at which the message is marked for removal and no longer available for retrieval from the entity due to expiration. Expiry is controlled by the property and this property is computed from +

member.name: T:Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.ServiceBusRetryMode
member.summary: The type of approach to apply when calculating the delay between retry attempts.

member.name: F:Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.ServiceBusRetryMode.Fixed
member.summary: Retry attempts happen at fixed intervals; each delay is a consistent duration.

member.name: F:Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.ServiceBusRetryMode.Exponential
member.summary: Retry attempts will delay based on a backoff strategy, where each attempt will increase the duration that it waits before retrying.

member.name: T:Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.ServiceBusRetryOptions
member.summary: The set of options that can be specified to influence how retry attempts are made, and a failure is eligible to be retried.

member.name: P:Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.ServiceBusRetryOptions.Mode
member.summary: The approach to use for calculating retry delays.

member.name: P:Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.ServiceBusRetryOptions.MaxRetries
member.summary: The maximum number of retry attempts before considering the associated operation to have failed.

member.name: P:Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.ServiceBusRetryOptions.Delay
member.summary: The delay between retry attempts for a fixed approach or the delay on which to base calculations for a backoff-based approach.

member.name: P:Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.ServiceBusRetryOptions.MaxDelay
member.summary: The maximum permissible delay between retry attempts.

member.name: P:Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.ServiceBusRetryOptions.TryTimeout
member.summary: The maximum duration to wait for completion of a single attempt, whether the initial attempt or a retry.

member.name: P:Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.ServiceBusRetryOptions.CustomRetryPolicy
member.summary: A custom retry policy to be used in place of the individual option values.
member.remarks: When populated, this custom policy will take precedence over the individual retry options provided.

member.name: T:Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.ServiceBusRetryPolicy
member.summary: An abstract representation of a policy to govern retrying of messaging operations.
member.remarks: It is recommended that developers without advanced needs not implement custom retry policies but instead configure the default policy by specifying the desired set of retry options when creating one of the Service Bus clients.

member.summary: The instance of which can be mocked for testing.

member.summary: Calculates the amount of time to allow the current attempt for an operation to complete before considering it to be timed out.
member.param: The number of total attempts that have been made, including the initial attempt before any retries.
member.returns: The amount of time to allow for an operation to complete.

member.name: M:Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.ServiceBusRetryPolicy.CalculateRetryDelay(System.Exception,System.Int32)
member.summary: Calculates the amount of time to wait before another attempt should be made.
member.param: The last exception that was observed for the operation to be retried.
The number of total attempts that have been made, including the initial attempt before any retries.
member.returns: The amount of time to delay before retrying the associated operation; if null, then the operation is no longer eligible to be retried.

member.summary: The dead-letter subqueue contains messages that have been dead-lettered.

member.name: F:Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.SubQueue.TransferDeadLetter
member.summary:
The transfer dead-letter subqueue contains messages that have been dead-lettered when the following conditions apply:
A message passes through more than four queues or topics that are chained together.
The destination queue or topic is disabled or deleted.
The destination queue or topic exceeds the maximum entity size.

member.remarks: The first call to fetches the first active message for this receiver. Each subsequent call fetches the subsequent message in the entity. Unlike a received message, a peeked message will not have a lock token associated with it, and hence it cannot be Completed/Abandoned/Deferred/Deadlettered/Renewed. Also, unlike , this method will fetch even Deferred messages (but not Deadlettered message).

member.name: M:Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.ServiceBusReceiver.RenewMessageLockAsync(Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.ServiceBusReceivedMessage,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Renews the lock on the message. The lock will be renewed based on the setting specified on the queue.
member.remarks: When a message is received in mode, the message is locked on the server for this receiver instance for a duration as specified during the Queue/Subscription creation (LockDuration). If processing of the message requires longer than this duration, the lock needs to be renewed. For each renewal, it resets the time the message is locked by the LockDuration set on the Entity.
member.param: The to renew the lock for.
An optional instance to signal the request to cancel the operation.

member.name: M:Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.ServiceBusSessionReceiver.RenewSessionLockAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Renews the lock on the session specified by the . The lock will be renewed based on the setting specified on the entity.
member.param: An optional instance to signal the request to cancel the operation.

remarks.para: When you get session receiver, the session is locked for this receiver by the service for a duration as specified during the Queue/Subscription creation. If processing of the session requires longer than this duration, the session-lock needs to be renewed. For each renewal, it resets the time the session is locked by the LockDuration set on the Entity.
Renewal of session renews all the messages in the session as well. Each individual message need not be renewed.

member.summary: Attempts to add a message to the batch, ensuring that the size of the batch does not exceed its maximum. If the message is modified after being added to the batch, the batch will fail to send if the modification caused the batch to exceed the maximum allowable size. Therefore it is best to not modify a message after adding it to the batch.
member.param: The message to attempt to add to the batch.
member.returns: true if the message was added; otherwise, false.
member.exception: When a batch is sent, it will be locked for the duration of that operation. During this time, no messages may be added to the batch. Calling TryAdd while the batch is being sent will result in an until the send has completed.
